article.Heading: Budget 2017: Demonetisation will create cleaner, bigger GDP, says Jaitley
article.Summary: Demonetisation has been a bold decision of the government against black money, Finance Minister Arun Jaitley said is his Budget speech today.
article.Body:
Moneycontrol Bureau

Demonetisation has been a bold decision of the government against black money, Finance Minister Arun Jaitley said is his Budget speech today.

"We are moving from informal to formal economy and the government is now seen as a trusted custodian of public money," he said.

The impact of cash crunch will not spill over the next financial year. Demonetisation will create a new normal for a bigger, cleaner Gross Domestic Product (GDP) and any impact, if there is, will be transient.

Demonetisation and the Goods & Services Tax (GST) both will have great impact on the economy and lives of the people. Jaitley also assured that the re-monetisation pace has picked-up in the economy.

On November 8, the government had launched the demonetisation drive - banning of high currency notes - to curb black money and to digitize the economy.

Finance Minister further said that demonetisation will transfer resources from tax evaders to the government.
